DataElement.preferredDefinition: The severity or intensity of the event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Severity of Adverse Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._The intensity of a specific adverse event evaluated based on the magnitude of clinical signs, symptoms and findings. Severe adverse event may be of relatively minor medical significance. The term is not synonymous with the term seriousness of adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: The intensity of a specific adverse event evaluated based on the magnitude of clinical signs, symptoms and findings. Severe adverse event may be of relatively minor medical significance. The term is not synonymous with the term seriousness of adverse event.

Concepts.definition: The intensity of a specific adverse event evaluated based on the magnitude of clinical signs, symptoms and findings. Severe adverse event may be of relatively minor medical significance. The term is not synonymous with the term seriousness of adverse event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6.8.21 Released to support CDISC CDE metrics clean-up. mc 7-26-18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task; tt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Severity Intensity Scale for Adverse Event Terminology Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Severity Intensity Scale for Adverse Event within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk. See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.

Concepts.definition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An experience that is usually transient, and requires no special treatment or intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual daily activities. Includes transient laboratory test alterations. See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.

Concepts.definition: An experience that is usually transient, and requires no special treatment or intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual daily activities. Includes transient laboratory test alterations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.

Concepts.definition: An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

Concepts.definition: Terminology codelist used with Severity Intensity Scale for Adverse Event within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What is the severity of the a
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the severity of the adverse event?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the event using the sponsor-defined categories. This assessment is subjective and the reporting physician/ healthcare professional should use medical judgment to compare the reported Adverse Event to similar type events observed in clinical practice. Severity is not equivalent to seriousness.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Either AESEV or AETOXGR must appear on the CRF. Some studies may mandate the collection of both. Refer to ICH E3 guidelines for CSR Section 12.2.4.

ReferenceDocuments.name: AESEV
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.
